BASIC PURPOSE: The Quality Assurance /DE will work within structured processes and procedures to ensure that all assigned or workflow-appropriate database records and fields meet or exceed the Company’s database standards and requirements as defined by the CAN Initiative, or similar expectations of database accuracy and completion that may be subsequently modified. The Specialist must have a strong technical ability to learn and use software applications. The Specialist must also possess strong analytical and internet research skills, as well as excellent communication, organization and written skills, including the ability to deal effectively with other personnel and departments. The Specialist must also demonstrate an ability to balance multiple tasks and assignments on an ongoing basis, including quickly switching between them as required to adjust to new projects or workflow priority changes. Lastly, the Specialist must also possess and be able to maintain a high level of ongoing familiarity with Specialist standards, process and client expectations, and overall CAN adherence and accuracy as required by all appropriate production teams, with specific emphasis on data connectivity between departments and all Program-, Awards- or Contributor-related fields.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Overall responsibility is to ensure the successful completion of all assigned program records and fields contained within the proprietary database.
  • Perform database clean-up projects and programming audits to ensure current company and CAN Standards are being adhered to within existing production team processes and workflows.
  • Use new and existing contacts to acquire and/or validate information that has been entered into the proprietary database.
  • May require the ability to proof existing, variable length television and movie program descriptions, celebrity biographical facts, etc.
  • As required, demonstrate and maintain awareness and ability to use internal software and tools, including the Awards Database, External URLs, Descriptive Workflow Queues, Media Manager, Product Manager Program/Schedule Lookups and Contributor/Program Lookups.
  • Apply a variety of research techniques, such as contacting new and existing contacts, and usage of approved Internet sites and streaming/OTT platforms, sites and applications for onscreen credit verification to gather the information required to be entered into the proprietary database.
  • Responsible for providing daily summary reports to the Production Manager, including communicating issues, ongoing trends, setbacks and/or successes.
  • Provide ongoing feedback to Production Manager, and/or other supervisory staff and peers on current assignments, including asking questions which may allow for improved efficiencies, output or ongoing corporate knowledge.
  • Perform title completion audits and program locks by the end of each week for all individually assigned domestic theatrical film releases for that week, including all CAN-required fields pertaining to CARM levels 1, 3 and 4.
  • Perform title completion audits and program locks for all individually assigned TV Series parent and episode records, including all CAN-required fields pertaining to CARM levels 1, 3 and 4.
  • Per Red Bee Media and CAN Standards, make sound decisions regarding the contextual accuracy of given data points, including making judgment calls for peer Editors in cases of Entities with conflicting stage names, disputable program-level data points, incongruously provided schedules, etc.
  • Ability to perform the research necessary, both internally and through approved sources, to make sound decisions of data point validity as defined by Corporate Styles and Standards.
  • As fielded through company-wide requests, reports and notifications, identified via CAN Review workflows, or delegated by the Production Manager and/or or other team/dept. personnel, perform corrective action to resolve duplicate or problematic Entities, Title records and other data points assigned unique IDs, as well as Title and Contributor Name changes, all of which falling under the umbrella activity name of Quality Control.
  • Report results of Quality Control activity on a team-wide tracker to be used for daily reporting to Media Content, Content Analytics, Data Compliance and all Supervisory personnel from relevant production teams.
  • Will often function as the primary arbiter, below the Production Manager, in cases where data point validity is in dispute but a Standards-driven decision can and must be made to benefit additional departmental or company-wide personnel, or client-driven issue reporting.
  • Assist as required for company needs in time-sensitive or OT-required Database Enhancement or Quality Assurance/Control projects in preparation for conventions, demos and presentations to prospective clients.
  • May require an ability to work in specialized areas of proprietary software and products, including newly developed fields or data points as required to meet company/department goals and client needs.
  • Employee understands that he/she will have other duties as required and/or assigned, which may or may not be encompassed specifically in their ongoing workflows and responsibilities.

  • Quality Control
    • Perform Quality Control work assignments including Search and Replace tool usage, Contributor/Program credit Pull-Aparts and Contributor and Program Name Changes as identified through ongoing assignments, as fielded through company-wide requests, reports and notifications, identified via CAN Review workflows, or delegated by the Production Manager. Minimum stats will depend on the volume of such work available to perform, but the Specialist will be expected to perform at least 10 percent of all such activity available on an ongoing basis.
  • Reports
    • Maintain and regular report on an ongoing basis an individual assignment tracker to keep awareness of ongoing progress and results for all assigned tasks and projects and ensure timely completion of all deadline-driven workflows.
    • Send an EOD email to the Production Manager detailing each work day activity, providing status updates for ongoing projects, and noting questions or issues which require timely response to ensure assignment completion and accuracy.
    • Provide daily reporting of Quality Control activity on a team-wide tracker to be used for daily reporting to Media Content, Content Analytics, Data Compliance and all Supervisory personnel from relevant production teams.


REQUIRED JOB SKILLS:

  • Must be willing to take direction and criticism from superiors regarding the completion and accuracy of their work.
  • Constantly demonstrate the ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and make sound recommendations through written documentation and reports.
  • Strong research, analysis and problem-solving skills in order to work effectively with all levels of Red Bee Media.
  • Excellent data entry skills with attention to detail and accuracy.

  • Strong technical foundation (Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Outlook and Excel, and Data Systems familiarity).

  • High attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Highly organized and motivated to excel.
  • Works well in a team environment.
  • Excellent oral and written communications abilities.
  • Solid analytical, technical, and problem solving skills.
  • Self-motivated and willing to work in a fast-paced environment.

About ASCAP

The American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers (ASCAP) is a membership association of more than 900,000 songwriters, composers and music publishers, and represents some of the world’s most talented music creators. Founded and governed by songwriters and composers, it is the only performing rights organization in the U.S. that operates as a not-for-profit. ASCAP licenses a repertory of over 18 million musical works to hundreds of thousands of businesses that use music, including streaming services, cable television, radio and satellite radio and brick and mortar businesses such as retail stores, hotels, clubs, restaurants and bars. ASCAP collects the licensing fees; identifies, matches and processes trillions of performances every year; and returns nearly 90 cents of every dollar back to its members as royalties. The ASCAP blanket license offers an efficient solution for businesses to legally perform ASCAP music while respecting the right of songwriters and composers to be paid fairly. ASCAP puts music creators first, advocating for their rights and the value of music on Capitol Hill, driving innovation that moves the industry forward, building community and providing the resources and support that creators need to succeed in their careers. Learn more and stay in touch at www.ascap.com, on Twitter and Instagram @ASCAP and on Facebook.

  • Perform data uploads.

  • Other tasks as assigned.

Skills and Requirements:

  • Strong communication skills.
  • Professional appearance and demeanor.
  • Technologically adept and familiar with latest trends in technology; AI/ML/AR/VR.
  • Organized and detail oriented.
  • Thrives in a team environment.
  • Ability to manage responsibilities in a fast-paced environment.

  • Experience in a related role such as customer service or data collection.

Residuals Analyst
Regular Full-Time

Position Overview

The Residuals Analyst processes residuals payments for assigned shows and is the point of contact for the client through the entire residuals payment process. The Residuals Analyst is expected to be able to accurately review, administer, and analyze residual payments.

Core Responsibilities

  • Set up of residual products, which includes:
    • Reviewing talent contracts and identifying the residuals made-for-market
    • Inputting or uploading talent, and making adjustments (adding buyouts to talent history, updating prior historical payments, etc.)
  • Compile run and revenue/receipts information, distributor statements, and distribution agreements to process residual payments in accordance with Guild deadlines.
  • Maintain working knowledge of union contract residuals provisions, fringes, regulations, deadlines, industry standards, and requirements.
  • Review payee contracts, timecards, and either inputting or uploading residuals triggers.
  • Create, review, and send residuals invoices, including creating manual timecards if needed.
  • Reissue lost, stolen, and stale dated residuals checks.
  • Maintain client relationships by responding to questions and requests relating to residuals setups and payments in a timely manner.
  • Keep accurate records by following residuals recordkeeping procedures.
  • Other related duties and projects as assigned.

Key Qualifications

  • Experience with residual setups and/or residual payments required.
  • Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Able to learn and use customized software programs, with basic to intermediate PC skills including Excel and Microsoft Word.
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively towards a goal.
  • Ability to develop and maintain working relationships with clients.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
  • Hands-on experience with end-to-end processing of entertainment residuals or royalties.
  • Entertainment payroll or accounting experience.

Special Work Conditions

  • Sedentary – Involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Some positions may entail exerting up to 15 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force to lift, carry, push, or pull.

jobTitle: Senior Medical Science Liaison- LVV (US, East Coast)
jobDescription:
Overview:
Work at ROCKET PHARMA and help cure rare diseases!

Rocket Pharma is a fully integrated, clinical-stage company advancing gene therapies with curative potential for multiple rare childhood diseases. Rocket places enormous value on people and considers team member progress and well-being to be as important as the progress of its pipeline. We are looking for hands-on team players who enjoy collaborating with colleagues. We share a passion for seeking gene therapy cures for devastating diseases and making a difference for patients. This is an opportunity to become an integral part of a small, highly productive team and to help grow an entrepreneurial, scientifically driven organization that is increasingly recognized as a leading biotechnology innovator. In addition to a competitive compensation package featuring a generous 401K match and stock options, the position includes excellent health benefits.
Position Summary:

The Senior Medical Science Liaison is a field-based medical/scientific expert who is responsible for educating multiple stakeholders about Rocket Pharmaceutical’s science and data. With a focus on developing impactful external relationships and conducting fair and balanced exchange of medical information with healthcare professionals, this position plays an important role in clinical trial execution, potential product launches, and potential new pipeline programs and is instrumental to Rocket’s efforts to develop curative gene therapies for patients with devastating diseases.


You will be joining at the early stages of Rocket establishing the field medical function and at an exciting time for the company. Initially, this position will cover the US Eastern states in support of Rocket’s three lentiviral programs (leukocyte adhesion deficiency type I, Fanconi anemia, and pyruvate kinase deficiency). As program needs and the team grow this may change to specific program(s) in a more defined territory. Some support for global activities may be required.
Responsibilities:
  • As a key externally facing role, the Sr. MSL must commit to unwavering representation of Rocket’s mission as an ethical, high science, patient-focused company.
  • Develop and maintain clinical, scientific, and technical expertise in relevant product and disease state areas.
  • Conduct balanced medical/scientific exchange to educate health care providers (HCPs), thought leaders (TLs), payors and patient advocacy groups about Rocket’s lentiviral gene therapy programs, to include disease state, diagnosis, mechanism of action, and data dissemination.
  • Assist cross-functional Medical Communication colleagues with development, review and approval of materials required for scientific exchange.
  • Contribute to development and execution of high-quality annual field medical strategic and operational plans, including HCP/TL engagement plans and comprehensive, national and regional congress plans.
  • Supports company research initiatives across development at the request of Clinical to include, but not limited to: site evaluation and identification, recruitment, investigator meetings, external expert identification, accrual enhancement, and scientific and disease state education. May include support for identification, activation and training of qualified treatment centers for administration of our gene therapies in the commercial setting, when appropriate.
  • Support the development and implementation of advisory boards and other scientific meetings as needed.
  • Monitor the competitive landscape for specific therapeutic areas of interest to Rocket, with a priority on support for the lentiviral programs, including: current management strategies, approved products, new/emerging therapies, and differentiating features of approved/emerging competitor products. Contribute to CI plan for medical congresses. Provide feedback to the senior management team on specific initiatives.
  • As part of scientific exchange with HCPs/TLs, and resulting from a deep understanding of corporate goals and program goals, be adept at identifying key insights and ensure that internal stakeholders are informed of these key insights, especially as they may pertain to successful execution of ongoing/planned clinical trials and product launches.
  • As necessary, assist with training Medical Affairs and other cross-functional colleagues on disease state, diagnosis, mechanism of action, and clinical trial data for the lentiviral programs.
  • Address unsolicited medical questions related to Rocket’s clinical programs and products in various forums e.g. regular scientific exchange, congress booths, ensuring timely and accurate and appropriate responses.
  • May be requested to support Medical Information as the function develops.
  • Supports investigator-initiated research and grants through review, submission, evaluation, and recommendation of concepts/proposals
  • Commit to unwavering compliance with Rocket’s policies and standard operating procedures and with regulatory and other ethical guidelines relevant to the MSL role and the pharmaceutical industry.
  • Extensive travel (approx. 60-70%; US, with the potential for some international travel).
Qualifications:
  • Advanced Clinical/Science degree or professional credentials required (MD/DO, PhD, PharmD, PA, NP, MSN, RN).
  • 8 years of experience in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry in Medical Affairs, with extensive experience working in field medical
  • Extensive Rare Disease experience required
  • Gene therapy experience, specifically lentiviral gene therapy and bone marrow transplant experience, preferred
  • Immunology and hematology experience preferred
  • Strong interpersonal, presentation and communication skills and demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced, team-oriented environment
  • Strong organizational and business planning skills. Strategic thinker with ability to contribute to development and execution of strategic plans
  • Creative problem-solving skills
  • Drive excellence and accountability personally; promote same for Medical Affairs colleagues
  • Ability to interact and communicate effectively with multiple internal and external stakeholders. Must have extensive experience conducting formal scientific presentations.
  • Strong analytical skills are essential, especially with regard to understanding and interpreting scientific/clinical research/literature
  • Adept, nimble, energetic and comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic and collaborative environment
  • Capable of – and motivated by - taking a proactive hands-on approach and "rolling up one's sleeves."
Compensation:
Salary range - $224,000.00 - $269,333.00
At Rocket, our compensation philosophy and ranges are built upon data and insights collected from validated world-class providers. We are committed to compensating employees equitably based on several factors, including responsibilities and level of the position, depth and types of the employee’s experience, location of the position and availability of similar talent in a competitive market.
EEO Statement:
A diverse workforce fosters innovation and strengthens Rocket’s business. We ensure equal opportunity without discrimination or harassment in the workplace on the basis of gender, race, color, religion, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, citizenship, status as a protected veteran, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state, and federal laws.

Job Title: Financial Data Analyst

Reporting to: Director of Finance

Location: Majestic Theatre, San Antonio, TX

Status: Full-Time


ABOUT THE POSITION

An established global live performance venue management company is seeking a Financial Data Analyst to join the North American Finance Team. This is an exciting opportunity to join a successful company in a unique industry. This position will further strengthen the existing finance team.

  • Ideal candidates will demonstrate outstanding multitasking, analytical thinking, problem solving and communication skills
  • Exhibit ethical behavior and ability to handle confidential information
  • Strong work ethic
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Able to operate within deadlines


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Support Business Partners responsible for managing the delivery of forecasting and planning
  • Support month end activities to include periodic reporting to Group Finance, Management Pack compilation, upload general ledger to Cognos
  • Maintain and control the integrity of forecasting models, updating data in support of Business Partners
  • Develop, improve, and maintain integrity of data files to align with needs of the business.
  • Facilitate the development and continued analysis of rolling forecasts
  • Work with Business Partners to continually improve forecasting processes
  • Facilitate the analysis of new projects to support good decision making
  • Develop relationships across the business to uncover frustrations and manual workarounds that users have created and propose/create alternative processes
  • As required, prepare presentations in support of key stakeholders. Understand the needs and wants of key stakeholders to provide them with what they need. Recognize the opportunities to provide fresh or reformatted information to enable better business decisions to be made.
  • Participate in special projects as required


JOB REQUIREMENTS


  • Degree in Finance or Accounting
  • Intermediate+ Excel skills in Office 365 environment, must use Power Query as a creator, experience with dashboard creation/graphs
  • Knowledge of financial reporting systems, TM1, and Jet are helpful
  • Ability to prioritize assignments/projects and multi-task within restricted time constraints

EXPECTED OFFER: 10/31/2022


ABOUT ATG

Nothing beats the energy and excitement of a great live performance. That’s why our mission is to bring the very best in music, theater, comedy, and more, to the largest possible number of people. Since 1992, we’ve grown to be a world leader in live entertainment. 10 million people a year attend live performances at one of our 50 iconic venues across North America, the United Kingdom and Germany. That number keeps growing. We partner with the world’s top creative talent and present critically acclaimed productions which have won more than 80 Tony and Olivier Awards over the years. We also operate some of the world’s most popular theatre ticketing sites, with 11 million and counting customers getting their tickets directly from us.

People are at the heart of our success. Our core values - Passionate, Smart, Collaborative and Ambitious – are about our people. Thousands of people work for ATG worldwide and it’s their passion and commitment that allows us to create great live entertainment experiences. Learn more about ATG, visit www.atg.co.uk/


ATG’S INCLUSION, DIVERSITY, EQUITY, & ACCESS MISSION STATEMENT

Our stages are a platform for compelling stories – stories that are for all, by all, and of all. We shine our spotlight on our differences and believe that understanding and celebrating these differences makes us better global citizens. We are passionate about the pursuit of true diversity and equality. We strive to make our venues beacons of these ideals in our communities. Onstage and off, we hold ourselves accountable for nurturing an inclusive culture, one in which everyone can bring their authentic selves. At ATG, we provide a stage for everyone.

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Games is on the lookout for an energetic Scan Capture Specialist, experienced in face scanning and directing mobile data acquisition sessions, who will be directing shoots at Rockstar's unique performance capture studio, in either Los Angeles, California or Long Island, NY.

WHAT WE DO

  • Direct scan shoots for face and body data acquisition.
  • Instruct talents to meet specific performance expectations during scan shoots, including Facial Action Coding System requirements.
  • Work alongside other departments in the R&D of various aspects of our pipelines pertaining to scan data like body and facial rigging, animation, and character art.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Direct all scan shoots for 3D and 4D data acquisition.
  • Calibrate and maintain Scan Rigs for optimal performance.
  • Liaise with other department's leadership to define requirements for data capture.
  • Create training material for talents and to assist QA review process of acquired data.
  • Review and produce reports post scan shoots, classify data acquired, and approve final shots to be processed by the computing farm.
  • Document and provide feedback on the hardware and software setup, working with our teams to improve scanning processes.
  • Innovate and document ways of capturing scans physically and through pipelines.
  • Create a comfortable friendly working environment for the talent and team to assist in getting the best performance.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proficiency in Facial Action Coding System (FACS).
  • Previous experience directing/working with actors.
  • Genuine enthusiasm for facial and body anatomy and motion.

SKILLS

  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal.
  • Proven experience directing scan shoots for 3D static poses and 4D sequences.
  • General knowledge of 3D asset creation pipelines for games or films.
  • Experience operating multi camera scan rig 3D/4D.
  • Proven knowledge of DSLR and or machine vision cameras.
  • Proven knowledge of Photogrammetry.
  • Have technical knowledge of the anatomy of various types of scan rigs.
  • Experience in correctly exposing, framing and lighting subjects for scanning.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

  • Certification as proficient Facial Action Coding System (FACS) coder.
  • In-depth familiarity of Rockstar products.
  • Experience using multicam software CaptureGRID/Breeze.
  • Experience using photogrammetry software Metashape/RC.
  • Experience setting up a face/body scan rig.
  • Quick problem solving of technical and physical issues.
  • Experience teaching/training.
  • Experience in NeRFs, Lidar and other forms of 3D Capture.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

SCHEDULING COORDINATOR

Rhino Staging Tempe Office is currently seeking a highly organized, detail oriented individual who can effectively manage their time, prioritize work and multitask across several, ever changing projects. This person would be working onsite with the office team to properly coordinate and schedule employees for multiple events in and around the surrounding area.

We value people based on merit and strong work ethics and are looking for a dedicated, hardworking, organized individual with a positive attitude and great communication skills to join our Rhino Team.

RHINO STAGING

Rhino Staging is a full-service production company, with a main focus on staffing labor for concerts, corporate events, festivals and many other live events. For nearly three decades we have nurtured growth in the entertainment industry across the country, with branches in most major cities. Established in 1991, we put an emphasis on hiring quality employees as well as offering job training and putting safety as a number 1 priority. As we continue to grow, we have more and more need for hard working, dedicated staff who have career growth opportunities in mind.

Job duties and requirements include but are not limited to:

  • Administrative duties, answering telephone calls and directing calls to appropriate parties.
  • Placing employees in the appropriate jobs and interaction with employees and clients for scheduling purposes.
  • Generating labor quotes.
  • Data entry.
  • Basic computer skills are required, specifically Microsoft Excel.
  • A professional appearance and demeanor.
  • Polite and professional phone etiquette with the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse range of personalities.
  • Ability to work well in a team atmosphere.
  • Projects as necessary.
  • Training on our Citrix bases scheduling program will be provided.

This position also requires extreme attention to detail and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. This is a full-time position working the hours of 9am - 5pm or 10am - 6 pm. Flexibility in your schedule, to include weekends and holidays will be required. This individual in this position is also required to carry the "on-call" cell phone for one week at a time once per month and handle any orders or scheduling that occur during non-business hours. Pay rate is $20-$21 per hour plus applicable overtime and benefits include Medical, Dental, & Vision.

Typical Job Tasks

  • Schedule employees for multiple event sites, shifts, and travel jobs.
  • Data entry, such as uploading timesheets, receipts, and client / employee information.
  • Interact daily with employees and clients to process requests, schedule changes, and general inquiries.

Preferred Experience

  • Past administrative assistant experience
  • Experience in sales or a call center environment
  • Experience with Google docs, spreadsheets, email and excel
  • Solid computer skills and an aptitude for learning new software
  • Ability to work remotely some nights and weekends


READY TO JOIN OUR CREW? We understand your time is valuable, so we have a very quick and easy application process. If you would be right for this on-call position, please fill out our quick and easy mobile-friendly application.

We look forward to meeting you!

Responsibilities

  • Manages calendars and schedules; coordinates meetings and appointments with both internal and external participants, at times across multiple time zones
  • Screens and responds to heavy incoming call volume and email correspondence

  • Networks professionally with external assistants, coordinators, junior execs and representatives to build relationships
  • Other ad hoc duties as required

Requirements

  • Minimum 1 year of desk experience in entertainment industry; within a literary department strongly preferred
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, especially regarding script coverage, notetaking, verbal reporting on material
  • Highly proficient with MS software including Word, Excel, Outlook
  • Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to interface with staff, other administrators & coordinators, senior management and creatives as required, both internally and externally
  • Ability to prioritize workload efficiently and meet strict deadlines for completing tasks & assignments
  • Ability to navigate two Executive desks simultaneously in a high-volume, fast-paced environment while keeping a level head
  • Self-motivated and proactive with attention to detail and follow-through skills; organization is a must!
  • Demonstrates good judgment and the ability to deal with confidential & sensitive issues
  • Familiar with a variety of industry concepts, practices, and procedures a plus; such as relevant software skills, general understanding of budgeting and production

We’re looking for methodical, task-driven individuals who can help our Data Diagnostics team improve our processes and SOPs.

As a part of our hiring process, we ask that you please complete this 8-10 minute culture survey to be considered for this role at SLM: https://go.apply.ci/s/hkCjJZOjpt

Who is Second Life Mac: SLM is the industry leader in Apple device buybacks for schools and businesses. We are the thought leaders when it comes to educating our clients on maximizing the value of their used Apple devices and ensuring that students/employees always have the technology they need to do great work. We purchase used devices, bring them to our facility to be cleaned and refurbished, then give them a second life by selling them to consumers at a great price. We’re a company that puts significant focus on helping our team members maximize their human potential. In fact, we’re so dedicated to this purpose that we embed it into our long term business plan and vision.

The right candidates: We are looking for people who fit our core values (Do Whatever It Takes, Positive Energy, and Take Action). SLM hires and promotes using these values and they are in the core of every Team Member we have, people either have them or they don’t. SLM is an incredibly entrepreneurial company and people with that mindset fit in extremely well with our team. We are looking for people who want to be a part of something bigger, something special, something life-changing.

Data Diagnostics

Description of duties:

  • Utilize specialized software and tools to perform data erasure on Apple devices, following established protocols and procedures.
  • Conduct thorough inspections of Apple devices to identify and securely erase all data, including contacts, messages, photos, videos, apps, and other personal or sensitive information.
  • Collaborate with team members to efficiently manage and prioritize erasure tasks based on device type, quantity, and urgency.
  • Maintain accurate records and documentation of erasure activities, including device information, erasure status, and any issues or exceptions encountered.
  • Stay updated with the latest Apple devices, operating systems, and data erasure technologies to continuously improve erasure processes and stay ahead of potential security risks.
  • Follow established safety protocols and guidelines to ensure a safe working environment and proper handling of devices throughout the erasure process.
  • Provide training and guidance to team members on data erasure best practices and procedures.
  • Support other data security initiatives as needed, including data destruction, device refurbishment, or other related tasks.

STAND 8 provides end to end IT solutions to enterprise partners across the United States and with offices in Los Angeles, New York, New Jersey, Atlanta, and more including internationally in Mexico and India.

We are seeking a Data Engineer to work on various projects for a large school district client.

Qualifications and Duties
  • Set up R Studio Workbench, Connect, and Package Manager on a Linux server.
  • Manage libraries and versions.
  • Write required security plan.
  • Work with security to connect the server to Snowflake and other data sources.
  • Provision server access to data scientists, including R Studio Server, sftp, and command line.
  • Provide training and support to data scientists, including training on visualization packages like ggplot2, Quatro, and Shiny.
  • Guide data scientists on how to use version control with GIT/Azure Devops.

Virtuoso® is the leading global travel agency network specializing in luxury and experiential travel. This by-invitation-only organization comprises over 1,200 travel agency locations with 20,000 travel advisors in 50 countries throughout North America, Latin America, the Caribbean, Europe, Asia-Pacific, Africa and the Middle East. Drawing upon its preferred relationships with more than 2,200 of the world’s best hotels and resorts, cruise lines, airlines, tour companies and premier destinations, the network provides its upscale clientele with exclusive amenities, rare experiences and privileged access. Normalized annual sales of (U.S.) $25-$30 billion make Virtuoso a powerhouse in the luxury travel industry. For more information, visit www.virtuoso.com.

The Data Delivery Specialist must be able to gather and evaluate the data sync issues/setup and provide input on prioritization as applicable. The Data Delivery Specialist will also play a key role in working with Virtuoso Members and Advisors to enable and maintain high quality data sync and related functionality. This position is hands-on and requires very good understanding of data transfer, data mapping and manage relationships with members and internal IT teams (engineering, Service Center, etc.).

The successful Data Delivery Specialist must stay abreast of professional standards, trends and issues affecting their set of responsibilities, demonstrating continuous learning. Must work collaboratively to be effective in support of building a team-based culture and be familiar with and committed to Virtuoso’s mission, strategy, and goals.

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
  • Leads/Assists with new back-office data sync creation and ensures that data is processed as expected.
  • Efficiently track, investigate, and manage data sync related issues to determine resolution and escalation.
  • Analyze data issues directly using readily available reports as well as custom built data queries to identify root cause.
  • Interfaces directly with Virtuoso Members to help with their data sync setup/maintenance.
  • Collaborate, test and implement new data processes that affect department operations.
  • Maintain data integrity and confidentiality in compliance with data privacy standards such as GDPR.
  • Understanding long-term business objectives and suggesting strategies to meet those objectives, introducing innovation to business processes through technology if appropriate.

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business administration, operations engineering, or related field
  • Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills
  • 3+ years of SQL experience including troubleshooting or production support experience
  • Experience working with external customers or members in a service capacity
  • Strong interpersonal, communication (written/verbal), teamwork and consensus building skills
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision
  • Travel industry experience or Ecommerce experience with CRM or online sales is a plus
  • Experience with travel agency back-office systems is a plus

Travel Requirements:
  • Travel is rarely required for this position (0-1 trips per year).
  • Travel will be entirely domestic.

Type/Nature of Contacts:
  • External: Daily contact with members and suppliers.
  • Internal: Daily contact with Virtuoso staff.
